page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY, CWMBRAN
page.content: In 1801 Cwmbran had a population of 600 and they worked in wood,coal and tinplate.In 1891 brick and pipe factories made the area prosperous.The population rose to 10,000.In 1949 Pontnewydd,Cwmbran and Croesyceiliog joined together to form Cwmbran New Town.The number of people then was 35,000 .The Development Corporation built the Town Centre and most of the houses.In 1985 the number of people living in Cwmbran is 44,500.There are 150 shops including supermarkets and a department store,a theatre,library and cinema.Other amenities include banks, estate agents,solicitors, building societies and free parking for 3,000 cars.All shopping can be done under cover.Outside the Congress Theatre is a bandstand where shoppers are entertained.Cwmbran is a modern, busy and prosperous new town.
